alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 13 at 5:54AM EST until November 14 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, water runup to the dune line, minor coastal flooding and beach erosion expected around the times of high tide, especially in vulnerable locations of Volusia County. For the Beach Hazards Statement, rough choppy surf and a southward flowing longshore current in the surf zone today. A Moderate risk of dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia, Mainland Northern Brevard and Northern Brevard Barrier Islands Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 11 AM EST Wednesday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 10 AM EST this morning through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Some flooding of low-lying lots, parks and roadways may occur near the shoreline. Only isolated road closures are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning high tides will occur today between 700 and 730 AM, Tuesday between 800 and 830 AM, and Wednesday around 900 AM.
info.instruction: Onshore winds and above normal tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Entering the surf is strongly discouraged.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands
